title: Russia-Ukraine talks to resume in Geneva as US claims ‘meaningful’ progress
partialText: The trio will 'continue working towards a deal' in the third round of negotiations, US special envoy Steve Witkoff says.

title: Peru impeaches President Jose Jeri over corruption allegations
partialText: Peru’s Congress has ousted President Jose Jeri just four months into his term over multiple corruption allegations.

title: Russia-Ukraine talks live: Geneva talks resume, Kyiv sanctions Lukashenko
partialText: Ukraine says Russia launched aerial attack as officials from both sides resume US-mediated negotiations.

title: Cambodian PM says Thailand occupying ‘deep’ territory after ceasefire
partialText: Hun Manet calls for border demarcation and says US President Donald Trump's Board of Peace could 'play a role'.

title: ‘Quid pro quo’: How Indian firms fund parties whose governments help them
partialText: Big business shrugs off Supreme Court ban on electoral bonds to donate millions when in trouble, or needing approvals.

title: Boxing legend Manny Pacquiao to face Ruslan Provodnikov in April
partialText: Eight-division ⁠world champion Pacquiao will face former junior welterweight world ⁠champion ⁠Provodnikov on April 18.

title: Video: Over 80 UN states condemn Israeli measures in occupied West Bank
partialText: More than 80 UN nation ambassadors have condemned Israeli measures to tighten its control of the occupied West Bank.

title: Ronda Rousey, Gina Carano end MMA retirements to fight in May
partialText: Rousey will return to MMA for the first time in nearly a decade when she challenges ⁠Carano on ⁠May 16 in California.

title: Ramadan begins in Palestine, Gulf; Egypt, Syria, more Muslim states to come
partialText: Palestinians in Gaza face food shortages, restrictions as Israeli attacks continue during Islamic holy month.

title: Nine skiers missing, 6 trapped after north California mountains avalanche
partialText: Rescuers battle blizzard to save six skiers found trapped after avalanche in the Sierra Nevada mountains in western US.

title: Global pressure does little to stop Israel’s anti-Palestinian policies
partialText: Many Israelis see condemnation as evidence of anti-Semitism, rather than a verdict on their government's actions.

title: Gaza welcomes Ramadan amid fragile ‘ceasefire’ and fears of renewed war
partialText: Despite displacement, Gaza families strive to create joy this Ramadan, navigating grief, scarcity, and fragile peace.

title: Philippine VP Sara Duterte announces run for president in 2028
partialText: Announcement follows multiple impeachment complaints against the vice president over allegations of corruption.

title: Updates: Israel steps up attacks, land takeover across occupied West Bank
partialText: Ramped-up raids, violent settler attacks and bulldozed homes - Israel escalates its assault on the occupied West Bank.

title: Washington appoints new US envoy on Tibetan human rights
partialText: China has previously criticised the role, accusing the US of interfering in China’s internal affairs.

title: Over 80 UN member states condemn Israel’s de facto annexation of West Bank
partialText: UN warns that Israel's plan will lead to widespread dispossession of Palestinian land in the occupied West Bank.

title: Iran says ‘good progress’ made in nuclear talks with US in Geneva
partialText: Top diplomat says Iran and US reached an understanding on 'guiding principles' in nuclear talks as tensions persist.

title: Over 80 film workers slam Berlin festival’s silence on Israel’s Gaza war
partialText: Tilda Swinton and Javier Bardem among actors and directors expressing dismay at Berlinale's 'anti-Palestinian racism'.

title: Kremlin official says Russian navy to stop West’s seizure of merchant ships
partialText: Russian official says Western powers seizing sanctioned vessels carrying Moscow's oil commit 'piracy-like attacks'.

title: ‘Tug of war’: Democrats push Trump to release New York City tunnel funds
partialText: New York Governor Kathy Hochul said the $77m released Tuesday falls short of the amount owed for the transport project.

title: Police arrest man with shotgun running towards US Capitol building
partialText: The suspect, identified as Carter Camacho from the US state of Georgia, was wearing a tactical vest and gloves.

title: UN panel says Epstein abuses may constitute ‘crimes against humanity’
partialText: Experts say newly released documents show the need for an independent investigation into Epstein's sex-trafficking ring.

title: Stephen Colbert says CBS pulled interview with Texas Democratic candidate
partialText: US late-night show host says CBS pulled interview from Monday's broadcast over fears it could violate new FCC guidance.

title: France arrests nine over killing of far-right activist Quentin Deranque
partialText: Quentin Deranque, 23, was beaten to death by far-left activists in France's Lyon last week.

title: How Jesse Jackson helped empower US Arabs and lift up the Palestinian cause
partialText: Arab American advocates eulogise Jackson as a civil rights giant who embraced their communities and defended Palestine.
